file_content.text: I'm sure I'll see you around.
... which is why you shouldn't have tried to hide this from us! How can the SIS do its job if you lie to us?
You are in no position to demand anything from me, Agent Balkar. I will conduct Special Forces' affairs as I see fit.
Treason? Mass defection? You're covering up a threat to the entire Republic.
I'm back. The operation was a success.
Yes, the operation. That's just what we were discussing.
What were you thinking, Lieutenant? I gave you specific orders, and you ignored them.
Not everyone can deceive their allies, General. Some people actually have standards.
We have a responsibility to be honest with our fellow agencies and departments.
Lies don't help anyone.
Your responsibility is to follow orders.
Telling you about the defection had no impact on the operation.
I shouldn't have talked.
Showing a modicum of respect for people outside SpecForce counts for something, I think.
You lied to me. You knew all about the traitors, about a direct threat to the Republic, and you helped cover it up.
I had to figure it all out for myself; dig it up like some enemy secret.
I would think that someone in your line of work would understand the necessity of secrecy, Agent Balkar.
General Garza told me not to tell you, Jonas. Nothing personal.
Orders are orders.
Great. I feel much better.
I should've told you the truth. It might have helped.
I'm sorry, Jonas.
Yeah, well, it's too late for that now, isn't it?
What's done is done.
Enough!
You're absolutely right.
This discussion is over. Lieutenant, contact me on your ship's holo when everything with M1-4X has been settled. Garza out.
Ugh. I don't know how you work with that woman.
Look... you were just following orders. I know how it is. Let's not talk about it.
The job got done--and it was no small feat. You've definitely earned your reward.
I just did my duty, Jonas, nothing more.
No reward necessary.
I'm afraid modesty isn't going to get you out of this one.
What kind of reward are we talking about, here?
Reward?
Make it quick and make it important, Jonas. I have places to be.
This better be good.
I think you'll be suitably impressed.
Ahem. "Republic war droid M1-4X is to be repaired and direct control transferred to Havoc Squad's current commanding officer immediately."
Want to go meet the newest member of your squad, Lieutenant?
Absolutely, Jonas.
Yes!
M1-4X was destroyed. How is this possible?
Are you kidding me?
Apparently you weren't nearly as thorough as you could've been. You really ought to be ashamed of yourself.
M1-4X is programmed to obey Tavus--how can we be sure he'll be on our side?
I can't trust that machine!
Our technicians are the best in the Republic. If they say he's clean, then he's clean.
Come on--follow me.
All right, that should wrap things up. Activating now.
Diagnostics... complete. All systems operational. Unit M1-4X, reporting for duty!
Welcome to Havoc Squad, M1-4X.
At ease.
You guys are good. There's barely a scratch on him.
Wow, just like new.
Glad you approve. You didn't exactly make it easy on us.
Finally, my very own killer war droid.
This is going to be fun.
Lieutenant--I'm very pleased to see you again. Your work in disabling me was incredible. Republic soldiers obviously are the best in the galaxy.
It will be an honor to fight alongside such an exceptional servant of the Republic. Together, we'll crush the mindless hedonists of the Sith Empire!
I'm glad to have you back on our side, Forex.
Right on!
It's a pleasure to return to the service of freedom and democracy, sir.
Will your shields and weapons be as powerful as they were when we fought?
Are you fully operational?
Unfortunately, no--your skillful assault reduced my power core's charge back to its baseline. But this is only a temporary situation.
Over time, my power core will gradually recharge, increasing my effectiveness until I can once again slay the Republic's depraved enemies with impunity.
You'd better stay in line, Forex. I beat you once--I can do it again.
Just remember who's in charge.
You are a true servant of the Republic's noble ideals. I will never have cause to question your command.
It's been a pleasure working with you, Lieutenant. Hopefully, the next time we meet will be under more honest circumstances.
See you around, Jonas.
Good working with you, too.
We make a good team, Balkar.
I'd be up for that.
You'd make a good SIS agent. If you ever get tired of the soldiering business, drop me a line.
I don't know. After the swath of destruction we burned across Nar Shaddaa, it might be better for the galaxy if we don't work together again.
Maybe more... private circumstances?
[Flirt.] I'd like that.
Consider it done. I'll be in touch.
You want honesty, maybe you should get an honest job.
Don't get your hopes up.
I do still have all the paperwork for that interior refurbishment company....
See you around, Lieutenant.
Lieutenant. It's Jonas.
I saw you talking to the Imps. Nobody shot anybody, so I'm going to take that as a good sign. Did you find out where our missing droid has gone?
The droid is in a facility in Shadow Town. Repeat, Shadow Town.
That's affirmative.
I can be very persuasive. Our missing friend is in Shadow Town.
Did you ever doubt me?
Fantastic work! I knew we could count on you.
I need to get to Shadow Town. Fast.
I don't have time to chat.
Ouch. That's not the best news.
Shadow Town is where the Imps put people who are too useful to kill, but too dangerous to leave roaming around the galaxy.
It's dangerous and heavily secured. Fighting your way in won't be the easiest thing you've ever done.
I'll be sure to stay on my guard.
Copy that.
No problem.
It's up to you to finish this. Get in, trash the droid and get yourself out so we can call it a day.
As much as I love our chats, I have work to do.
Can I go now?
Yeah, yeah. Go on, take out the rogue droid and save the Republic. We don't have all day.
We need to move fast. If you aren't gone from there soon, we're going to have a very hard time cleaning up what's happened.
We're going to have to cancel whole operations to bankroll this cover-up. Can't believe those dumb Imps started shooting!
If only I could've talked them down, you wouldn't be in this mess.
I'm sorry this happened.
I'm sure you tried everything you could.
Do you have a backup plan?
So what now?
I don't know how you could've thought that situation would end without a fight.
What did you expect?
We had them caught. I didn't think they'd want to risk causing a situation any more than we would. Clearly that was a mistake.
What were you thinking? Did you hear anything I said about avoiding a shoot-out in there?
It'll take everything the SIS has to cover this up--whole operations shut down because you couldn't keep your finger off the trigger.
The Imps wouldn't budge, Jonas. I didn't mean for this to happen.
I'm very sorry.
Well, it happened. So we'd better do something about it.
We don't have time for this. What's our next move?
Criticize me later.
If you wanted negotiations, maybe you should've sent a negotiator.
I'm trained to kill, not talk.
Yes, it's all my fault for assuming you were capable of speech.
Power up that computer bank. We shouldn't have trouble slicing in, now that nobody's alive to notice. Let's see where our missing droid's gone.
I'm powering the computers up now.
Copy that.
What have we got here... hmm.
If these computers don't have any answers, we're in trouble.
Let's hope so.
We're already in trouble... ah. Here we go.
Why don't I rummage through the Imps' uniforms for clues while I'm at it?
This is getting ridiculous.
If it'll give you something to do besides complain, go for it. Let's see now... ah. There we go.
M1-4X is in Shadow Town--that's where the Empire keeps prisoners that are too useful to execute or enslave. Particularly scientists.
Those scientists have figured out how to supercharge the war droid's power core with some kind of rare alien tech. If you don't stop them, M1-4X will become invincible.
I'll get that droid put down ASAP.
I'd better get moving.
You can't be serious.
I doubt the Imperials would lie in their own files. You'd better get moving.
M1-4X is about to be nothing but scrap.
Not if I can help it.
I'll leave that in your capable hands.
I won't hold you up anymore. Get to Shadow Town and stop this thing so we can all go home.
Good luck. Jonas out.
Hey there, soldier. Niall just made it back and told me how much heat you took on covering for him.
You two did great. You're on the safe list, our tracks are covered, and I'm even tapped into all of the casino's security cams.
Now I can keep an eye on you in there. You look good, by the way.
We've got a job to do, Jonas. Stick to the op.
Keep it professional, please.
Thanks for noticing; I have been working out lately.
[Flirt] It's all the exercise.
Ahem. Is this discussion entirely necessary?
Are you kidding me? What is wrong with you people?
Hey, hey, no need for any insubordination, we'll get back to the mission.
Yeah, we've been running you around pretty hard.
Skip the charm, Jonas. It won't get you anywhere.
I'm not interested in you.
Fine, fine. You're no fun.
I'll be able to keep an eye on everything; make sure nobody gets the drop on you.
I appreciate you watching my back.
Sounds good to me.
In there, you'll need all the help you can get.
My armor has a camera built in for this kind of thing.
Why not use the armor-cam?
The Imps have slicers on Nar Shaddaa, too. Using your armor-cam would just give them lots of chances to crack it.
Constant supervision doesn't help me do my job.
I don't like it.
Relax, I'm not keeping tabs on you. I'm keeping tabs on everyone else.
You're walking into a hell of a situation here, Lieutenant.
Questioning the Imps about the droid is one thing, but if this comes down to shooting... the Republic can't afford that risk.
If anyone starts trouble, it won't be me.
Understood.
That's all we can ask of you.
Maybe these Imperials will turn out to be really nice guys.
You worry too much.
I wouldn't bet on it. Let's try to play it safe here.
I'm finding out where that droid is, no matter what.
I won't make any promises.
Starting a galactic war over one droid isn't expert strategy. You need to play it safe.
One more thing--I ran the images we got from the vault, checking faces against our databases.
The weird thing is, I didn't find them in our Imperial or criminal databases. I found them in Republic Special Forces personnel records. Weird, huh?
I didn't know anything about that.
It's news to me.
Traitors to the Republic? We've got to do something!
I can't believe it!
So, you had no idea that a bunch of SpecForce traitors had gone rogue. Hm. Interesting.
All right, I won't hold you any longer. Get up to that penthouse and get us some answers.
And don't get yourself killed doing it. Jonas out.
Commander Tavus defected to the Empire, and a lot of other SpecForce soldiers went with him.
They're all traitors.
Wow. That's even worse than I had suspected. Is there any particular reason the SIS doesn't know about this? Any reason you chose not to tell me before now?
General Garza gave me strict instructions not to tell.
Orders are orders.
Ah. Of course she did. Well, I appreciate you telling me now, at least.
SpecForce problem, SpecForce solution. No reason to bring in anyone else.
Why would we tell SIS?
Defecting soldiers are a threat to the whole Republic. The SIS exists to find and stop people like that.
SpecForce will handle this. Your people would just get in our way.
It's not your concern.
"Our people" are some of the best Intelligence operatives in the galaxy.
We'll talk later. You'd better head up to the penthouse so we can find these traitors before things get any worse.
Good luck. Jonas out.
Niall knows his stuff. Keep him safe and we'll be in business.
The alarm signal from the arms factory led to a surprising place: a penthouse at the Club Vertica Casino.
The slicers tell me that the computer systems at the other end of the alarm signal were definitely Imperial. Apparently our friends are overseeing this operation in style.
Our slicers took a pass at the computers in the penthouse--all Imperial tech. Our rogue droid's Republic, but the Imps are giving the orders.
I'll breach the casino penthouse and eliminate all Imperials present.
Let's take them out.
Whoa, not so fast.
Imperials in a penthouse?
Yes. And it would seem that Imperial expense accounts are much more generous than ours.
I take it you have a brilliant plan?
What are we going to do now?
That's my job.
Club Vertica is an extremely public place. We have to get you through the casino and up to the penthouse without any bloodshed.
That's where my friend Niall Piv comes in. Niall's our top slicer here. He'll make sure nobody hassles you on the way to the penthouse.
Pleasure to meet you, Niall.
Hello there.
Hm... oh, yes, thanks. It's nice to meet you, too.
Nice to know I'm worthy of your top talent.
Your best slicer, huh?
Of course. The best for the best.
SpecForce gave us their best, so it's the least we can do.
How's a slicer supposed to get me past armed guards?
This runt is protecting me?
Club Vertica has a "safe list"--a list of people allowed to go in and out of the penthouse at any time.
It's Niall's job to get you added to that safe list. But he needs your help.
Hm? Oh, yes, Club Vertica's systems are highly secured. The only way to add you to the safe list is from inside the system.
There's a substation down in the Lower Industrial Sector. It belongs to the casino, so its computers are tied into the casino's systems. We need you to get Niall inside.
I'll make it happen.
Understood.
What kind of opposition should I expect?
Will there be guards?
Sneaking into places is your thing. What do you need me for?
Why me?
Stealth isn't an option on our time frame.
Security for the substation is heavy--the casino's contracted some of the priciest mercenaries around.
Good luck to you.
Now, was that fun, or was that fun?
The operation certainly catered to the lieutenant's specialties, at least.
You definitely picked the right squad for the job. This was right up the lieutenant's alley.
I wasn't the only one impressed with your moves, either--the alarm pulled in a very interesting audience.
If you like what you see, maybe you should do something about it.
[Flirt.] I aim to please.
Trust me, there's a reason I'm trying to get all of this boring "save the Republic" business out of the way quickly.
Is this entirely necessary? Pointless... fraternization like this is clearly proscribed by our Personnel Interaction Guidelines.
Apologies, Sergeant. We'll keep things professional from now on.
I guess that's true.
Suit yourself, Lieutenant.
We're just talking, Elara. No harm in that.
Don't worry so much.
You are occupying mission time with non-mission activities.
This isn't any of your business, Sergeant.
Back off, Elara.
I'm here for the mission, Lieutenant, and anything impeding the mission is very much my business.
Well, arguing like this isn't very efficient either; so let's just move on.
Get your priorities straight, Balkar, or I'll straighten them out for you.
We're all on the same side here, Jorgan.
Take it easy.
We'd better be.
Sergeant, if you'd prefer to discuss mission details, I'm happy to oblige.
Jealousy doesn't suit you, Sergeant.
Are you jealous, Jorgan?
What? I don't... I mean... ugh! Am I really the only one who cares about the mission, here?
Yeah, I'd rather discuss violence against people who aren't me.
This should be fun to watch.
Fight! Fight!
Not if I can help it. If Sergeant Jorgan would like to focus on the mission, then let's focus on the mission.
It was quite a performance. And if our signal trackers are accurate, you pulled in a very interesting audience.
Were you able to find the Imps our traitors are working for?
What have we learned?
Did you find out anything more about the droid's accomplices?
What have we learned?
It's easy to do well when you love what you do.
I'm glad you approve.
Yes, you clearly have a passion for your work.
I didn't think this op would bring in anything but posthumous decorations.
So your stupid plan worked?
Guess you'll have to wait a little longer for that highly decorated coffin.
Have a good time in there.
Hey there. Welcome to Balkar Interior Refurbishments, Incorporated. Be sure you review the new employee manual.
As long as we're holding a position, it's best to stay inconspicuous.
Nice cover.
Exactly. You've got a knack for this business.
Giving up the spy business?
A new job, huh?
Thought I'd like a less conspicuous career than "Republic Intelligence team leader." Although I will miss the benefits.
Skip the spy nonsense and give me the droid's position.
Don't waste my time.
I've got bad news. The droid and his friend gave us the slip just after you and I spoke on the holo.
They jumped into an access tunnel and blew it behind themselves. Tracking them down again is going to take time.
Do we have some kind of backup plan?
So what do we do?
Time isn't something we have a lot of, Jonas.
This is bad.
Which is why we need to work with what we've got.
I can't believe you lost them!
Too bad you're stuck with us.
If these men are traitors, then they'll have Imperial supervisors. We just need to find out where.
Whoever these guys are, they aren't working alone. Somebody on Nar Shaddaa is helping them, and it's time we found out who.
I'll bet these guys would call for help if you shot up their arms factory. Then, we trace that call straight to whoever's really in charge.
That's a good plan. Let's make it happen.
Pretty clever.
I'll try not to clear the place out before anyone manages to hit the alarm.
I guess it might work.
Try to restrain yourself, just this once. For the good of the mission.
You lost me, there.
You attack the abandoned arms factory, forcing the droid's accomplices to call for help. We track the call and find out who's in charge.
First thing's first: You'll need to plant these signal trackers around the arms factory so that we can trace the distress call.
Then, you kick down the door and do what you do best while we see who gets a call. Sound like a plan?
Time to wreak a little havoc.
Affirmative.
Do we move to a new location afterward?
What happens when I'm done?
Not much of a plan, but I didn't want to live forever anyway.
Can't say that I approve.
Ha! From what I've heard, this is the kind of op Havoc handles best.
We'll be waiting for you here when the party's over. Have fun.
I have a team setting up shop in a warehouse not far from the arms factory. Meet up with us there.
I'll move out ASAP.
Understood.
We need to wrap this up before things get any worse.
Hope you've got a plan.
Don't tell me what to do.
I'd send you a written invitation, but we're on a bit of a tight schedule.
Keep your eyes open--the Red Light Sector isn't exactly the safest place in the galaxy.
See you soon.
Well. That was interesting, wasn't it?
Any idea where the droid went?
Are you tracking the droid?
We've got a pretty solid lead.
That wasn't so bad.
You think you could've done better, Jonas?
What are you trying to say?
No, when I said "interesting," I actually meant "interesting."
Our tap on the vault cams wasn't perfect, but the droid's crew looked like they were packing Republic heat, all standard-issue.
We didn't have audio, though. Any luck finding out who we're dealing with?
Sorry. No solid intel.
No, I didn't.
No problem. We'll get the whole story soon enough.
Enemies of the Republic. That's all we need to know.
It doesn't matter.
I can see why you chose this line of work.
Our people tracked the droid and his buddy. They just headed into an abandoned arms factory in the Red Light Sector.
They were Republic Special Forces soldiers who have defected to the Empire alongside Harron Tavus.
Our own men turned against us.
Defections in SpecForce? That's news. Big news. Any particular reason SIS isn't in the loop on this?
General Garza made it clear that she didn't want SIS involved.
Orders are orders.
Ah. So you're taking a pretty big risk, giving me the whole story on this. Thanks.
It's a SpecForce problem. No reason to drag other departments into it.
Why would we tell SIS?
Defections are a threat to the whole Republic. The SIS could help.
Your people would just get in the way.
It's not your concern.
Our people know what they're doing, just like yours. We could make your lives a lot easier.
But we'll talk later. Our new traitor friends have holed up in an abandoned arms factory in the Red Light Sector.
Go ahead and see to our friend. We'll watch your back.
Ah. There you are.
Go ahead, take a seat. And keep your voice down.
Jonas Balkar, correct?
Are you my contact?
Let's just stick with Jonas.
Are people listening in on us?
Why?
I would be.
Face like yours? I know I would.
I didn't come here to play your little spy games.
Don't waste my time.
If you say so.
Suit yourself. You look good from this angle, anyway.
Hope you like the cantina. It's not one of my favorites, but it is conveniently located.
There's a vault, not far from here. It's a merc operation, holds valuables for anybody with the credits to pay. Our mutual friend is about to pay them a visit.
Do we have a welcome party arranged?
What's the plan?
Not exactly, no.
Mutual friend? Are you talking about the war droid?
Huh?
Ahem. Yes.
How could you possibly know the war droid's next move?
You can't be sure of that.
Our friend's moves seem random, but we've found a pattern.
A group of paramilitary-types always shows up on the scene before the droid's attacks. We've already spotted them casing the vault.
You could head in now, but I don't want to scare them off. We wouldn't want the guest of honor to skip the party, would we?
It's your show, Jonas. When do we make our move?
Whatever you think is best.
It would be bad if our party was ruined. Definitely bad.
I guess not?
Are we going to mince words, or do our jobs?
Speak plainly.
On Nar Shaddaa, they're the same thing.
I have people with eyes on the vault. Once they spot our target, we'll get the party started.
So, Havoc Squad, huh? Pretty nice of Garza to loan us her very best. I'm--ah, excuse me.
Jonas! I just wanted to let you know I made it to Ithor safe and sound.
That's great! I'll talk to you later, then.
That's our cue. The target is in the vault. Are you ready to move out?
Let's get this party started.
Affirmative.
Are you coming with me, Jonas?
What about you?
Not my area of expertise. This job is all yours.
It beats talking to you.
I hear you. Like I said, not one of my favorite cantinas.
Take care of the droid and we'll have you on your way within the hour. Nice and tidy.
Good luck. We'll have our eyes on you.
We've got work to do.
Ah, Nar Shaddaa. Gotta love it, right?
Once we're past the security, just keep me covered, and you'll be an official Club Vertica guest in no time.
